title: What signs and instructions did Samuel give Saul for being King of Israel? - Quora

response.answer_text: WHAT SIGNS DID SAMUEL GIVE SAUL AS THE KING? Samuel was first told by the Lord that Saul would be sent to his town. When Samuel saw Saul the Lord said that is the man who I have chosen to rule Israel. The sign Samuel gave Saul was that Saul was not to worry about the lost donkeys because they had been found. Samuel told Saul then that he was the hope of Israel. The following day Samuel told Saul he would see 2 men by Rachel's tomb and those 2 men will tell you that your father is not worried anymore about the donkeys but he is worried about Saul. Then Saul would run into 3 men at Bethel, one with 3 goats, another 3 loaves of bread, and the third will have a wineskin full of wine and the 3 men will offer 2 of the loaves which Saul must accept. Then Saul is told he will meet a band of prophets at Gibeah of God, playing a harp, a tambourine, a flute, and a lyre and they will be prophesying. At that time the Spirit of the Lord will come upon Saul and Saul is told that he will also prophesy with them. He is told he will be changed as a person and after those signs Saul is to go down to Gigal and meet up with Samuel where they will make offerings to the Lord, but Saul must wait 7 days before Samuel would arrive and give the offerings with Saul. Burt Mottola, Christian evangelist, Christian musician ( piano )

SamuEL was a Canaanite prophet with a Canaanite name Sam (in) the God EL; as in IsraEL. Saul was the last nomadic Chief in the desert known as an Arab; “ Desert Dweller “ called by the Canaanites. King of nomadic tribes in the 11th C BC in Judea? Not even David, Solomon & Rebohoam were Kings. David is the 1st Chief to settle into their 1st village Hebron in 1018BC removing to village Shalim in 1011BC becoming a united village settlement; a village Chiefdom, with 2.100.000 tribesmen till 933BC, where it ends in a schism, with ten tribes leaving for village Shechem & two remaining in Shalim. The 1st Kings will be King Omri in Samaria in 874BC & King Jehoram in Judea in 853BC. There would then only be ‘subjects’ of the Kingdom of Israel; Israelites & ‘subjects’ of the Kingdom of Judea; Judeans! There was no Eretz Israel, empire, country, state, etc.
